sen.j: 杲宝（こうほう、徳治元年（1306年）- 貞治元年/正平 (日本)17年7月7日 (旧暦)（1362年7月28日））は、南北朝時代 (日本)の真言宗の学僧。
sen.e: Koho (1306 - July 28, 1362) was a Shingon sect scholar-monk during the period of the Northern and Southern Courts.

sen.j: 幼いころに出家して高野山にのぼり、その後は東寺宝菩提院の頼宝に真言密教を学んだ。
sen.e: He took the tonsure in his childhood and went up to Mt. Koya, and thereafter, he studied a form of Esoteric Buddhism 'Shingon Mikkyo' under Raiho of Bodaiin of Toji Temple.
In his childhood he went up to Mt. Koya to become a priest, and thereafter, he studied Shingon Mikkyo, a form of Esoteric Buddhism, under Raiho of Bodaiin of Toji Temple.

sen.e: In his childhood he went up to Mt. Koya to become a priest, and thereafter, he studied Shingon Mikkyo, a form of Esoteric Buddhism, under Raiho of Bodaiin of Toji Temple.

sen.j: ついで、槙尾山の浄宝に三宝流の灌頂を受け、勧修寺慈尊院の栄海に師事して伝法灌頂を受けた。
sen.e: Then, he underwent the ritual of consecration for Sanboryu by Joho of Makinoosan, and received the Dharma transmission abhiseka by Yokai of Jisonin of Kajuji Temple.

sen.j: 東寺勧学会学頭・法印・大僧正を歴任する一方、真言教学の研究に専念し、高野山の宥快とともに真言教学の中興の祖と称される。
sen.e: While successively serving as 'the head priest' of a Buddhist service Kangakue in Toji Temple, the highest ranked monk 'Hoin', and the highest rank in Japanese Buddhism 'Daisojo', he was dedicated to the study of the Shingon doctrine so that he has been regarded as the restorer of the Shingon doctrine together with the monk Yukai in Mt. Koya.
